unnormalised: **Vendor Audits Under Scrutiny in Manufacturing & Supply Chain**
normalised: Vendor Audits Under Scrutiny in Manufacturing and Supply Chain

unnormalised: Mumbai – Increased scrutiny is being placed on vendor audit processes across India’s manufacturing and supply chain sector, according to a recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII). The report, released on Oct 26, 2024, highlights growing concerns over transparency and adherence to quality standards, particularly amongst SMEs supplying components for industries like automotive and pharmaceuticals.

unnormalised: "A robust audit process is crucial, especially as we approach the festive season with increased demand," stated Mr. Ajay Sharma, Chairman of the CII Supply Chain Committee. " Imagine serving sub-standard biryani to guests during Diwali - the same principle applies to manufacturing; compromised components can lead to system failures and reputational damage."

unnormalised: Several large manufacturers, including Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra, are reportedly re-evaluating their vendor audit programs, incorporating stricter compliance checks and unannounced site visits. These firms are also investing in technology, such as blockchain, to improve traceability and prevent counterfeiting. One specific audit in Hosur flagged discrepancies in the supply of Rs. 5 Crore worth of bearings. Penalties up to Rs. 1 Crore are being levied for non-compliance in some cases. The average audit duration is now 3 days, up from 2 days last year.
